AU: TATSUMI, T; ASANO, K; YANAGISAWA, K
BE: Weitkamp, J; Karge, HG; Pfeifer, H; Holderich, W
AF: TATSUMI, T; ASANO, K; YANAGISAWA, K
TI: FACTORS DETERMINING SUBSTRATE-SPECIFICITY IN TITANIUM SILICALITE CATALYZED OXIDATIONS
SO: ZEOLITES AND RELATED MICROPOROUS MATERIALS: STATE OF THE ART 1994
SE: STUDIES IN SURFACE SCIENCE AND CATALYSIS
AB: Factors determining the substrate specificity in the oxidations catalyzed by titanium silicalites TS-1 and TS-2 have been investigated. Diffusion has been revealed to play a major role in the shape selective oxidation of alkanes. There is a significant difference in the shape selectivity and influence of cosolvent among a variety of substrates. Polarity of the substrate as well as its size is important in this liquid phase oxidation using aqueous H2O2.
